byline.original: By CHRIS LABZDA and BON DUKE

headline.print_headline: Ukraine Seizes Another Russian Soldier in East of Country-Interfax
headline.main: Ukraine Seizes Another Russian Soldier in East of Country-Interfax

docs.snippet: Ukraine has seized another Russian soldier in the east of the country who has confessed to providing military support to separatist rebels, Interfax news agency said on Wednesday, citing the SBU state security service.    It sa...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukraine has seized another Russian soldier in the east of the country who has confessed to providing military support to separatist rebels, Interfax news agency said on Wednesday, citing the SBU state security service.    It said the soldier, a 19-year-old private in a motor rifle brigade of the Russian armed forces, had said during questioning that his military unit funnelled military equipment, including Grad missiles and armoured vehicles, to pro-Russian separatists.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Lawmaker Pleads Guilty in GOP Caucuses Case
headline.main: Ex-Lawmaker Pleads Guilty in GOP Caucuses Case

docs.snippet: A former Iowa lawmaker has pleaded guilty to federal charges stemming from his switch of support from one Republican candidate for president to another before the 2012 caucuses, federal prosecutors said Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former Iowa lawmaker has pleaded guilty to federal charges stemming from his switch of support from one Republican candidate for president to another before the 2012 caucuses, federal prosecutors said Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Says Russian-Directed Counteroffensive in Ukraine Cities Likely Underway
headline.main: U.S. Says Russian-Directed Counteroffensive in Ukraine Cities Likely Underway

docs.snippet: The United States said on Wednesday new military incursions on Ukraine's eastern border indicate a Russian-directed counteroffensive is likely underway in two Ukrainian towns....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States said on Wednesday new military incursions on Ukraine's eastern border indicate a Russian-directed counteroffensive is likely underway in two Ukrainian towns.

headline.print_headline: USC's Shaw Admits to Lying About Injuries, Rescue
headline.main: USC's Shaw Admits to Lying About Injuries, Rescue

docs.snippet: Southern California cornerback Josh Shaw confessed that he lied to school officials about how he sprained his ankles last weekend, retracting his story about jumping off a balcony to save his drowning nephew....
docs.lead_paragraph: Southern California cornerback Josh Shaw confessed that he lied to school officials about how he sprained his ankles last weekend, retracting his story about jumping off a balcony to save his drowning nephew.

headline.print_headline: EU to Beef Up Border Agency to Deal With Migrants
headline.main: EU to Beef Up Border Agency to Deal With Migrants

docs.snippet: The European Commission agreed Wednesday to Italian demands to replace Rome's politically unpopular emergency operation for rescuing would-be refugees crossing the Mediterranean with an EU-wide project....
docs.lead_paragraph: The European Commission agreed Wednesday to Italian demands to replace Rome's politically unpopular emergency operation for rescuing would-be refugees crossing the Mediterranean with an EU-wide project.

headline.print_headline: Cypriots Protest Proposed Bank Loan Legislation
headline.main: Cypriots Protest Proposed Bank Loan Legislation

docs.snippet: Hundreds of Cypriots have staged a protest outside the presidential palace against proposed legislation aimed at helping the bailed-out country's beleaguered banks collect on bad loans....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of Cypriots have staged a protest outside the presidential palace against proposed legislation aimed at helping the bailed-out country's beleaguered banks collect on bad loans.

headline.print_headline: U.S., Blackwater Defense Clash on Jury Summary of Shooting
headline.main: U.S., Blackwater Defense Clash on Jury Summary of Shooting

docs.snippet: A U.S. prosecutor and a lawyer for a former Blackwater Worldwide security guard on Wednesday presented a jury with starkly different summaries of a 2007 shooting at a Baghdad traffic circle that sparked international outrage and charges of murder ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. prosecutor and a lawyer for a former Blackwater Worldwide security guard on Wednesday presented a jury with starkly different summaries of a 2007 shooting at a Baghdad traffic circle that sparked international outrage and charges of murder or manslaughter for four guards.
